answers.answer: GO TO THE DOCTOR.. it can mean you have preeclampsia. That causes protein in the urine, swelling of hands/feet. As well as dangerously high blood pressure.Ask them to test you ASAP! It can kill both you and the baby. It causes women to stroke out or have a heart attackOR it could be complications of your GD... i'd suggest you ask about it.

It is good that you have an appt. tomorrow w/ your OB.  He'll/she'll check your BP and your urine (as you know) and that will tell a lot.  I would def. tell him/her about these sensations that you are having.  Preclampsia is always a possibility.  But your urine and BP would let him know that.  My SIL has had it w/ all 3 of her kids and had to be induced.  With her first it was 1 month early.  With her 2nd, it was only a couple of days before her due date.  With her 3rd, it was about 2 or 3 weeks.  With #3, she just went for her regular check up and they sent her over to L&D to be induced that afternoon.Good luck and keep us posted!!
you can ask then to strip yor membrane thats what they did with me a week before my due date because i was so uncomfortaable good luck

My sister is due in 3 weeks on easter sunday and she is having the same problem her feet were purple at her baby shower last weekend. She went in yesterday and they said her b/p and urine was fine it was just the joys of pregnancy. She is afraid to ask to be induced or have her membranes striped even though she is ready for her to come this is her last week of work so I think it should get better . Good luck to you.
Definitly ask the doc to do something.  martikadragoon is right!

Ask your doctor to check you out.  I've had severe swelling in my pregnancies...but it's just swelling...I've never had preeclampsia or anythng else but with you already having the gestational diabetes it's best to have it checked out.  You can always be induced now at 37 weeks IF the doc will do it, but remember inducing brings with it a higher chance for complications and higher risk for c-section.

question: I am due in 3 weeks, and lately i've become very very swollen and my hands and feet are triple the size they used to be. My hands also feel very tingling and times and i can't even hold a pen for how much it hurts. I have an appointment with my OB tomorrow and i was wondering if its a good idea to ask if i can be induced or if something can be done. I also have gestational diabetes that sometimes can get out of control, even with the diet.What do you think?
title: Should i ask?
